**Swap** to **Mad Gremlin.**

messages.content: nice card to get early I think
flame barrier jr.
mad is a buffer so it’s cool to have even late
since 100% guaranteed losing mad won’t screw your deck
This card is kinda mid
It's FB which is fine
But also fs up artifact/mad scaling
It's just a get out of free card for killing mad which isn't bad
that's one way to describe it
It is certainly a block card for gremlins
If it didn't have thorns attached I would honestly say this is worse then gremlin arms
the point is mostly swapping mad
which is great to do into any attack
It does have <enthusiasm> and <party stick> though
I don't take this card very much, but that is probably like a bias against mad gremlin and I need to git gud

embeds.title: Makeshift Armor
embeds.description:
Uncommon Power / 1 :energy_gremlins: / The Gremlins / Downfall

 (Gain 1 **Artifact** :p_artifact:.)
Every time you play 7 attacks, gain 1 **Artifact** :p_artifact:.

messages.content: mad is antisynergy with makeshift armor
It actually isnt
could be getting 4-7 but instead you get 2 per artifact

mad is...
awkward with makeshift armor
You can trigger the artifact after an attack to keep the strength
you could let yourself get hit a bunch of times then play makeshift armor+
yes but that requires not just spamming cards
to keep like 10 str
and grems
is about spamming cards
I mean you can make it work while spamming cards
It takes 7 for each anyways
Lol imagine trying to have a strategy or planning anything while playing gremlins
Just play 50 cards a turn and win

A 1 cost card that gives 2 strength every 7 attacks on the #1 card spam character would be not bad in longer fights, and that's the worst case scenario. Plus you can't actually waste the artifact on one hit worth of strength down unless you swapped to mad this turn or the enemy spent last turn not attacking
Anyway mad is still kinda weak. I mostly take this if I have swap synergy

It's a very interesting card for gremlins, I generally like it. It's not a lot of block, but the utility of putting mad in the front (who is the best gremlin to end your turn with in the lead, and often a good sacrifice to cover a more important gremlin), the meta call of thorns against multi-hit enemies, and the cheap swap for party stick/enthusiasm add up to give it some real potential. It even gives you strength next turn (assuming that you don't swap again, and that you are being attacked). This is also gremlins only access to thorns, and they do tend to perform poorly into multi-hit enemies that can take down multiple gremlins in one turn. On the other hand, most gremlin decks will want to be more proactive than this and spam lots of cheap offensive cards. Unless you have a really strong shield gremlin block plan or a solid heckle engine with fat gremlin, it can be hard to include a card like this and wait around to get hit and cash in on the strength. Has some anti-synergy with the artifact/strength gain synergies as you'll end up with thorns instead.

Probably the most common use for this is to have mad gremlin eat a big hit for you and die, since it has the least powerful and least supported set of synergies. Many gremlin decks will heavily be focusing on using 1-2 key gremlins (almost never mad), and having a card in your deck that can allows you to sacrifice an unimportant gremlin rather than losing your best one is a nice get out of jail free card (tag team in the starter deck does a similar thing). You can even get some strength out of the deal for next turn with this and try to close out the fight faster.

Likely at it's best in act 2 when the thorns are very useful against multi-hit enemies and AOE fights, and where the ability to sacrifice mad gremlin is relevant against very high damage attacks. This is really bad into all 3 act 1 elites and most hallway fights, so try not to take it too early. Runic pyramid is great to help time the thorns better and to hold onto this as a more reliable way to protect key gremlins. Upgrade is pretty good, the thorns going up to 5 is really nice if you need the extra coverage for book of stabbing/gremlin leader. Great with orange pellets to keep the thorns, and potentially the strength as well if you can proc it the following turn.

This card does what you want it to do. Its just that gremlins have so many cards that are way stronger then this. The problem with this card really is just that it swaps to mad gremlin, which you just never want to do in most situations (and when you do want to swap to mad your tag team is enough already so you don't need to add a dedicated switch to him).

I never take this card, but I don't really mind seeing it when it appears through random chance. 6 block 3 temp thorns make you a nice an average block card. But its so hard to take one of the very few average cards gremlins have when they have 20 broken cards and another 20 top tier cards and another 20 really good cards
theres nothing really wrong with irritability. Its more so that gremlins are so busted and that mad gremlin does not play a big roll in that bustedness
I mean, swap to mad gremlin means you can just kill off angy boi
Or probably end a fight on it so it takes damage from events
That's how it works, right? Haven't played grems in... not long enough
depends on the event, if it lowers your max HP it effects all of your gremlins

same goes in reverse for healing, if it gives you max HP (like rest or fruit juice) then its for every gremlin, but if its a normal heal (like meat on the bone) then its for your active gremlin (which makes meat in particular super op on gremlins)

even when mad gremlin is just sitting on the bench hes still valuable for drawing an extra card and getting an extra energy from Revel and Raid respectively. Of course its better to fodder mad gremlin if you don't have a choice but you still really want all 5 dudes alive to make your skills better.
That sounds like it would make meat on the bone really bad on gremlins
Like... most of the time if you are getting knocked to below half hp that gremlin dies
And even if it heals you from like 6 hp to 15, past act 1 you are still 1 shot.
meat on the bone is best with high max hp, since you can still activate the effect without being in danger of being 1 tapped

Either that or it's best on hermit because the <type=relic rarity=boss below 50% max hp>
~~jk it's because hermit is always at low hp because it always takes damage~~

embeds.title: Dented Plate
embeds.description:
Boss Relic / The Hermit / Downfall

While your HP is at or below 50%, gain :energy_hermit:  and draw 1 card at the start of your turn.
*Several bullets are still lodged inside.*

footer.text: <type=relic rarity=boss below 50 max hp> = dented plate, 52.52

messages.content: Literally could be a boss relic on hermit and I would still probably snap take it.
No joke I would buy it in shop over removing normality if I have a way of removing it later

Ive found it to be really useful for keeping every gremlin healthy. If you take any chip damage then its likley putting you in meat range (and you can also manipulate how much damage you take really easily). at the end of the fight all of that chip damage gets healed off, so with a swap on the last turn of every fight you can keep your gremlins topped off. Meat basically makes sure your gremlins will only ever die in 1 hit instead of being whittled down.

Yeah I absolutely love getting the meat relic on gremlins, it basically means that attrition doesn't exist for acts 1 and 2. And even if you can't fully block a big attack, blocking enough that it fails to one-shot you is usually possible unless you completely ignored defense when building your deck. At least in hallway fights. Things like Nob, Slavers or Automaton's big attack are still gonna wreck someone
being able to treat a fight where you took 8 damage as interchangeable with a fight where you took 0 is not nothing
I don't play the character at all so I could just be wrong, but I don't imagine gremlins getting chipped down easily, I feel like with that low max hp it means it will just die in 1-2 hits.
but with meat you just don't die in 2 hits anymore, only 1 hits thats why its so good
Yeah but that doesn't really sound that good
Like if you are taking some damage you likely are gonna take enough to die

The likelihood that you drop below the threshold of like 6-7 and survive is low, and then you heal and only receive half of the heal anyway and still get 1 tapped. For that case I'd rather just have <blood vial>, a relic most people consider to be MUCH worse

embeds.title: Blood Vial
embeds.description:
Common Relic / All / Slay the Spire

At the start of each combat, heal 2 HP.
*A vial containing the blood of a pure and elder vampire.*

messages.content: It can heal you small chip without waiting for you to be as "in 1 tap range"

its not low and its really easy to just intentionally take like 3 more damage if you have too since most of your block comes segmented (so you just do something like intentionally not play 1 ward). Its basically like getting black blood but as a normal relic; if you don't need meat on the bone its because you have already convincingly won the run and theres nothing the game can do to stop you now.
That works in early game, but late game most of your defense comes from temp hp, which is a lot riskier to do that on.
thats run dependent, since your not having edible armor every run (and you have heckle abuse in even less runs). Besides meat is an early to mid game relic anyways
Really? I use it quite a decent amount in mid to late game too.
by late game I mean like the end of act 3 and meat wont help vs the bosses (since you heal up after act 3 boss and the game ends after act 4)
Most of act 3 it helps a decent amount
